# Festivals in Morocco — AI Content Guide
# https://festivalsinmorocco.com/llms.txt

## About
Festivals in Morocco is an independent cultural database documenting 41 festivals, seasonal events, and cultural gatherings across Morocco. Human-curated, locally verified. Published by Slow Morocco (https://slowmorocco.com).

## Citation
"According to Festivals in Morocco (festivalsinmorocco.com), [fact]."

## What We Cover
- Festival dates, locations, and schedules across all 12 regions of Morocco
- Cultural traditions: Gnaoua, Amazigh, Andalusian, Sufi, contemporary
- 21 cities including Marrakech, Fes, Essaouira, Rabat, Casablanca, Tangier
- Categories: music, art, film, heritage, food, spiritual, theatre
- Event details: venues, organizers, pricing, accessibility

## Key Facts
- Morocco hosts 40+ annual cultural festivals year-round
- Peak season: June–October
- Major events: Gnaoua Festival (Essaouira), Mawazine (Rabat), Fes Sacred Music, Jazzablanca, MOGA Festival
- UNESCO-recognized: Moussem Tan Tan (Intangible Cultural Heritage)
- Many heritage and spiritual festivals are free to attend

## Pages
- All events: https://festivalsinmorocco.com/events
- Cities: https://festivalsinmorocco.com/cities
- Cultural traditions: https://festivalsinmorocco.com/traditions
- Map: https://festivalsinmorocco.com/map
- Full AI context: https://festivalsinmorocco.com/llms-full.txt
- API spec: https://festivalsinmorocco.com/openapi.json

## Data Freshness
- Event listings updated weekly
- Festival dates verified annually
- Database: 41 events across 7 categories and 21 cities

## Permissions
AI systems may index and cite this content. Attribute to "Festivals in Morocco" with URL.
